item.source: What BPM do you use for Future Bass?

item.title: What BPM do you use for Future Bass?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Debatable.

Music without discernible regular rhythm would be considered to have no beats/pulses.
There are many types of non-rhythmic/arrhythmic music including ambient, drone, free jazz, free improv, avant-garde/experimental, noise, chanting, …

However, ‘0 BPM’ could also suggest that there are discernible beats/pulses in the composition, but that the playing tempo is 0, which would mean the music doesn’t actually begin… which could be described as ‘no song’.

…which actually raises some interesting art/conceptual possibilities.

Read full topic
item.source: What BPM do you use for Future Bass?

item.source: What BPM do you use for Future Bass?

item.title: What BPM do you use for Future Bass?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I personally don’t understand why people fixate on BPMs.

Make the music you want to make, at whatever tempo feels right to you - and stop worrying about whether it fits into a specific genre mold or not.

If it happens to use a similar tempo, that’s fine. But don’t let what others have done dictate what you try to do with your own music.

Jus’ sayin’

Read full topic
